English: Hidden in the mist
Comment:
On load mission
STRM_ONLOAD_INTRO,Remote Soviet camp"
column6:
On load mission

STRM_23v01,Thank you for coming. We have matters to discuss."

English: First of all, good work with the defence yesterday. With our victory and incoming reinforcements we can finally go on the offensive.
But there are far more troubling issues.\NStas told me about your adventures on Everon, Sergei. And about the rebels there.

It's like a bad repeating dream because we did the same thing seven years ago.\nThe war on Everon was fabricated, beyond doubt. Both of them in fact.\nIt seems Zubarev wanted to provoke NATO into an open conflict. Maybe even to get them on Kolguyev.
But why would he do that?
In his case it's quite easy why. Whatever he does it's always on the orders of Volkov.
He attacked Everon on the orders of Vladimir Volkov... the Army General?
None other. Experienced politician and respectable military commander.\nSmart, ambitious and ruthless. A very dangerous man.
If he's fabricating claims for war and provoking the enemy, surely he wants only one thing - war with the west.
He took pages straight from Livanoch's book. Although this time he's not waving around with nuclear weapons. Not yet anyway.
If he does have a plan similar to Livanoch, then he will plunge the world into a war of unprecedented destruction.\nHe must be stopped.
Stopped? But you're talking treason!
Yes, you might call us traitors. But we are only traitors to him, to the man willing to start a nuclear war and destroy us all.\nWe are only loyal to our country, more so than he is.
Volkov is only loyal to himself.

I brought you on board, Sergei, because I believe you see things in the same light as we do.\nWe cannot allow that madman to start World War Three.\nWe cannot allow him to destroy Mother Russia. The West. The World. He must be stopped.

Livanoch had a mad plan and could not be allowed to execute it.
Do you know what happened that day when the Americans came for him?
I killed him. Shot him in the head. I could not go on anymore without doing anything.
I had to act. Does that make me a traitor? Then so be it, but I would do it again.
There are things worth dying for.\nAnd I am ready to make that sacrifice for our country and for the future of this world.
Well said, Grigory, I agree.
I'm.. I'm with you, of course. It's a lot to take in but I do think I understand.\nI am with you till the end, Stas, Grigory. You have my word and loyalty.

That's what I wanted to hear. But we cannot act, not yet.
Volkov has a plan - one that involves a fight with NATO on Everon, Kolguyev, maybe Malden, who knows.
We'll need to find out about this plan and act accordingly to stop it.
Volkov cannot be allowed to succeed in whatever his endgame is.
We shall stop him when the time is right. Together for victory!
Together for victory!
Come on lads, enough lollygagging. Time to earn your pay.
Comrade major, we follow you. In case you need any more charges, we have some in those crates.
Checkpoint
Supply Trucks
Ammo Depot
Tanks
Fuel Station
Choppers
Pick Up SpetsNaz
Exit Point
Checkpoint Cleared
